statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ -4 \\ 7 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -5 \\ 9 \\ -17 \\ 12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -9 \\ 13 \\ -29 \\ 28 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ -4 \\ 7 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -5 \\ 9 \\ -17 \\ 12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -9 \\ 13 \\ -29 \\ 28 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
